label: lem-euclidean-boundary-holder
name: Hölder continuity of the death probability

attributes_added.label: attr-holder-continuous
attributes_added.expression:
The death probability function $p_{\mathrm{dead}}(x,v)$ is locally Hölder continuous with exponent $\alpha_B^{\mathrm{Sasaki}}=1$ and constant $L_{\mathrm{death}}^{\mathrm{Sasaki}}(C):=2\big(p_{\mathrm{aff}}+\rho_*(C)q_{\mathrm{dir}}(C)\big)C_{\partial}L_{\mathrm{flow}}$, where:
- $p_{\mathrm{aff}}=\frac{1}{(2\pi\tau(\sigma_v^2\tau^2+\sigma_x^2))^{d/2}}$ is the supremum density for the uncapped Gaussian update
- $\rho_*(C)$ is the probability of velocity capping on compact set $C$ (from lem-euclidean-geometric-consistency)
- $q_{\mathrm{dir}}(C)=\frac{\exp(M_{\mathrm{kin}}(C)^2/(2\sigma_v^2\tau))}{(2\pi\sigma_v^2\tau)^{d/2}}(2\sigma_v^2\tau)^{d/2}\Gamma\big(\frac{d}{2},\frac{V_{\mathrm{alg}}^2}{4\sigma_v^2\tau}\big)$ is the directional density bound under capping
- $C_{\partial}=\sup_{0<\varepsilon\le\varepsilon_{\mathrm{tube}}}\frac{\operatorname{Vol}(N_\varepsilon(\partial\mathcal X_{\mathrm{valid}}))}{\varepsilon}$ is the tubular neighborhood volume constant
- $L_{\mathrm{flow}}=1+\frac{\tau^2}{m}L_F+\gamma_{\mathrm{fric}}\tau^2L_u+\frac{\tau(1+\gamma_{\mathrm{fric}}\tau)}{\sqrt{\lambda_v}}$ is the Lipschitz constant of the kinetic flow map

The bound states: $|p_{\mathrm{dead}}(x,v)-p_{\mathrm{dead}}(x',v')|\le L_{\mathrm{death}}^{\mathrm{Sasaki}}(C)\,d_{\mathcal Y}^{\mathrm{Sasaki}}((x,v),(x',v'))$ for all $(x,v),(x',v')\in C\times\mathcal V_{\mathrm{alg}}$.

proof_strategy.main_approach: Tubular neighborhood volume bound combined with Gaussian tail estimates
key_steps: Use Lipschitz property of kinetic flow map (lem-sasaki-kinetic-lipschitz) to bound position differences
Apply tubular neighborhood theorem (Federer 69, §4.18) to bound volume of $\varepsilon$-neighborhood of boundary
Split analysis into uncapped ($\|\tilde v\|\le V_{\mathrm{alg}}$) and capped ($\|\tilde v\|>V_{\mathrm{alg}}$) regimes
Bound uncapped regime using Gaussian density supremum $p_{\mathrm{aff}}$
Bound capped regime using directional density $q_{\mathrm{dir}}(C)$ and capping probability $\rho_*(C)$ from lem-euclidean-geometric-consistency
Combine bounds to obtain Hölder constant $L_{\mathrm{death}}^{\mathrm{Sasaki}}(C)$
